thread.title: Local prep sports: Pirates perfect in five matches, seize Pea & Lentil trophy
thread.title_full: Local prep sports: Pirates perfect in five matches, seize Pea & Lentil trophy

title: Local prep sports: Pirates perfect in five matches, seize Pea & Lentil trophy
text: Print this article Advertisement GENESEE, Ida. — Pomeroy went back to back here in Pea & Lentil volleyball tournament action. The Pirates defended their title with a perfect 5-0 run to the championship. Pomeroy swept through pool play with straight set wins over Logos 25-23, 25-8, over Tri Valley 25-13, 25-11, and over Grangeville 26-24, 25-12. The Pirates earned a shot at Southeast 1B league foe Colton in the semifinal. The Pirates prevailed 25-9, 25-15 to earn a berth in the championship match against host Genesee. The Pirates had dropped a two-set decision to Genesee back at the Pomeroy hosted Border Battle. It took three sets. The Pirates and Genesee split the first two sets, the Pirates took the first set in extra time 29-27. Genesee came back to tie the match with a 25-21 win. Pomeroy again went over time to pull out a 17-15 win in the decisive third set. “It was nice to get that win (over Genessee) after our two point losses to them earlier,” Pirate coach Jim Greene said. “It ended on a disputed call as the last point was called out for going over the antenna. We didn’t want to win on a disputed call, but it was a good win.” The Pirates only lost one set on the day. “In the later part of the day, we played our best volleyball of the year,” Greene commented. “We hit .310 and served 94 percent.” Ally Bott, Esther Schuh, and Ireland Mayfield led the offense. Bott posted 37 kills. Schuh added 32 and Mayfield finished with 21. Schuh was named to the all-tourney team. Mayfield set up the offense as she put up 56 assists. Kacey Halbert led the Pirate defense with 39 digs on the day. Toni Cloud was a perfect 57-of-57 with four aces from the Pirate serving line. Pomeroy improves to 14-3 on the season and takes a 7-0 SE1B record into the second round which starts Tuesday when Liberty Christian visits. Tigers top Northwest Christian, 6-1 SPOKANE — Prescott’s soccer team traveled north Friday and brought home a 6-1 victory over Northwest Christian. The Tigers opened scoring in the 11th minute, when Luis Garcia took a ball from Chris Gutierrez for the score. Garcia scored unassisted in the 24th minute, and added the hat trick on an assist from Gutierrez two minutes later. Jose Gonzalez scored in the 32nd minute on an assist from Manny Sanchez, Alberto Mendez took a ball from Ivan Figueroa three minutes later, and Ricardo Flores scored in the 60th minute to end scoring. Northwest Christian got its lone goal in the 58th minute when Cameron Weller found the back of the net. Oscar Garcia had four saves in goal for the Tigers. Prescott, now 6-2 overall, heads to Boardman, Ore., to face Riverside at 4 p.m. on Tuesday. More like this story
